column4: Hello. I have installed ubuntu 10.10 on my netbook but have a problem with wifi. I am able to see wifi networks and also connect to them. in fact I have connected to my wifi at home but while it says that I am connected and everything seems to be ok I am not able to browse the web or update or do anything that needs an internet connection
Could someone pls help me solve this problem?
pastebin output of "ip addr" and "ip route"
you have addresses on two different interfaces on the same subnet. why?
I don't understand what you mean. I have no idea why :\
do you have a wired connection and a wireless connection to the same network at once? what are the interfaces eth0 and eth1?
yes eth0 would be the ethernet which I am connected to cause eth1 which is the wifi won't work
you don't have a default route on the eth1
your computer doesn't know where to send the data for things that are not on your network
how did you configure the ip address on your wireless interface?
I didn't I just installed ubuntu 10.10 and then added the drivers from the hardware tool up on the panel. I rebooted and found my network on the wifi list and just connected
try disconnecting your wired network and doing "ping 192.168.1.1" to see if your wireless is really connected and you can get to your router
right, then you are not really connected to your wifi network
is the wifi network one and the same as the wired network?
